title: [jit] Add builtins for `size()` and list with defaults
body_html:
• aten::size() to match torch.Tensor.size
  • aten::list_with_default for semantics of torch.nn.modules.utils.list_with_default
  • converts adaptive_avg_pool2d and adaptive_avg_pool3d
  • previously something like BroadcastingList[int, 2] would produce errors in mypy since 2 is not a type. this PR changes BroadcastingList to include the size in the type name, so BroadcastingList[int, 2] -> BroadcastingList2[int]
body_text:
aten::size() to match torch.Tensor.size
aten::list_with_default for semantics of torch.nn.modules.utils.list_with_default
converts adaptive_avg_pool2d and adaptive_avg_pool3d
previously something like BroadcastingList[int, 2] would produce errors in mypy since 2 is not a type. this PR changes BroadcastingList to include the size in the type name, so BroadcastingList[int, 2] -> BroadcastingList2[int]
body:
* `aten::size()` to match `torch.Tensor.size`
* `aten::list_with_default` for semantics of `torch.nn.modules.utils.list_with_default`
* converts `adaptive_avg_pool2d` and `adaptive_avg_pool3d`
* previously something like `BroadcastingList[int, 2]` would produce errors in mypy since `2` is not a type. this PR changes `BroadcastingList` to include the size in the type name, so `BroadcastingList[int, 2]` -> `BroadcastingList2[int]`
